issue.title: bisync: beta time improvements

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### Intro

The bisync pull request #5164 appeared too large to fulfil in a single rclone release.

Plan is to merge it right after the rclone v1.57 release. The command will be available in the beta builds for a limited circle of beta testers until official release with rclone v1.58.
During the beta period we can merge a number of postponed items, **in particular breaking changes**.

This ticket will keep track of the most beta time changes. Large and critical changes will be split into separate tickets.
High priority items reflect changes breaking user experience and must be completed before 1.58. Medium priority items are required but not guaranteed by 1.58. Optional and low priority items will be implemented on best effort basis. Optional items don't even have dedicated tickets yet.

### High priority

- [ ] Track critical flags in saved sessions - #5678
- [ ] Support imprecise or absent modtimes - #5679
- [ ] Use hashsums, honor `--checksum` - #5683

### Medium priority

- [ ] Check file sizes - #5684
- [ ] Respect `--backup-dir` - #5685
- [ ] Align `--max-delete` semantics - #5680
- [ ] Optimize resync - #5681
- [ ] Track renames - #5690

### Low priority

- [ ] Handle deletion conflicts - #5691
- [ ] Honor `--interactive` and `--auto-confirm`
- [ ] Recover after transient failures - #5676
- [ ] Use **trie** for listings to reduce footprint - #5686
- [ ] Maintain session history - #5692
- [ ] Handle Google Docs better - #5696

### Optional items

- [ ] Parallelize move/rename operations
- [ ] Honor special `.rcignore` files
- [ ] Revisit progress display for bisync
- [ ] Handle case-insensitive filenames. Respect `--ignore-case` and `--ignore-case-sync` ([rcsync#54](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/54), [#4854](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4854))
- [ ] Synchronize empty dirs if supported by backend ([rcsync#63](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/63))
- [ ] Fix tests for Google Photos ([rcsync#53](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/53), [G.Photos issues](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Remote%3A+Google+Photos%22))
- [ ] Enable CI tests with OwnCloud (according to @cjnaz it's stable)
- [ ] Test should handle Dropbox "touch quirks" in a generic way

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
Hello, I'd just like to know what's the progress on this feature. Is anybody planning to work on this soon, or is it a low priority? Is there anything I can help with, without speaking Go? As far as I see, compared to a unidirectional sync, this would require keeping a full listing of the last known synced state, in order to figure out *where* a rename took place.

For context, my use case would be keeping a directory on my phone in sync with a NextCloud server, where files can be added, deleted and renamed/moved on both ends. My options seem to be a) finding a software solution that supports this, b) renting a (twice as expensive) server I can run Syncthing on, c) writing a Python script myself. Rclone seems to be close to a), hence I'm curious. By no means I intend to beg anyone to implement this feature sooner!

issue.title: bisync: bug fixes and new features including --create-empty-src-dirs and equality check

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Several `bisync` bug fixes and new features including `--create-empty-src-dirs` and equality check.
Described in (excruciating) detail [here](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636). And further articulated in the [proposed documentation changes](https://github.com/nielash/rclone/blob/256892d85c0f13934988bd64731e19e119836be5/docs/content/bisync.md).

In summary:
* Fixed an [issue](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=1.%20Dry%20runs%20are%20not%20completely%20dry) causing dry runs to inadvertently commit filter changes
* Fixed an [issue](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=2.%20%2D%2Dresync%20deletes%20data%2C%20contrary%20to%20docs) causing `--resync` to erroneously delete empty folders and duplicate files unique to Path2
* `--check-access` is now enforced during `--resync`, preventing data loss in [certain user error scenarios](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=%2D%2Dcheck%2Daccess%20doesn%27t%20always%20fail%20when%20it%20should)
* Fixed an [issue](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=5.%20Bisync%20reads%20files%20in%20excluded%20directories%20during%20delete%20operations) causing bisync to consider more files than necessary due to overbroad filters during delete operations
* [Improved detection of false positive change conflicts](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=1.%20Identical%20files%20should%20be%20left%20alone%2C%20even%20if%20new/newer/changed%20on%20both%20sides) (identical files are now left alone instead of renamed)
* Added [support for `--create-empty-src-dirs`](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=3.%20Bisync%20should%20create/delete%20empty%20directories%20as%20sync%20does%2C%20when%20%2D%2Dcreate%2Dempty%2Dsrc%2Ddirs%20is%20passed)
* Added experimental `--resilient` mode to allow [recovery from self-correctable errors](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=2.%20Bisync%20should%20be%20more%20resilient%20to%20self%2Dcorrectable%20errors)
* Added [new `--ignore-listing-checksum` flag](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=6.%20%2D%2Dignore%2Dchecksum%20should%20be%20split%20into%20two%20flags%20for%20separate%20purposes) to distinguish from `--ignore-checksum`
* [Performance improvements](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636#:~:text=6.%20Deletes%20take%20several%20times%20longer%20than%20copies) for large remotes
* Documentation and testing improvements

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes, mainly in this forum post:
https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636

It also fixes #6109 and addresses several other open issues: #6841 #5683 #5681 #5676 #5675 #5674

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
> Hello, I'd just like to know what's the progress on this feature. Is anybody planning to work on this soon, or is it a low priority?

@f0k I just submitted a [PR](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/6971) that should significantly improve this (albeit in a [slightly different way](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/6971/commits/6309fe0fb052deed5ef0c970e13ce49487ddb7c9).) Files and folders can now be renamed on both sides without needing to re-upload, or do a `--resync`, or end up with erroneous `..path1` and `..path2` versions. (However, the behavior is unchanged when a rename is on only one side.)
Nice! However, if I understand correctly, this does not help when a file is renamed only on one side and I would like the change to propagate to the other side without incurring a retransmission.

> Nice! However, if I understand correctly, this does not help when a file is renamed only on one side and I would like the change to propagate to the other side without incurring a retransmission.

You are correct.

As a note to anyone revisiting this later (possibly me), I think the technical limitation currently is that `--track-renames` doesn't work with `copy`, only `sync`. Whereas `bisync` uses `copy` to transfer the queued files to the opposite path, and then it does the queued deletes in a later step. Here's the line where it calls `CopyDir`:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/415f4b2b93cd39799818cc87349510d8f4f32fa1/cmd/bisync/queue.go#L26-L26

which then calls `runSyncCopyMove` with `fs.DeleteModeOff` hard-coded:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/415f4b2b93cd39799818cc87349510d8f4f32fa1/fs/sync/sync.go#L1141-L1144

`fs.DeleteModeOff` precludes `--track-renames`:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/415f4b2b93cd39799818cc87349510d8f4f32fa1/fs/sync/sync.go#L208-L211

I think it should be possible (and desirable) to support `--track-renames` for `bisync`, but it would take a bit of rethinking about how `bisync` queues work.

issue.title: bisync: performance

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### setup

11,265 files - 290.743MiB (90MB in ~5 files the rest are smaller and more equal in size)

Results the same regardless of Wasabi or iDrive (iDrive typically performs a little faster in every test but only ~5-10% on average)

Remote is using crypt and base32768 encoding. 

BW: ~1.5MiB UP ~5MiB DOWN

### default/common flags

After testing best performing filters are: --transfers 64 --checkers 128 --fast-list

Along with this (--filter-from) or (--filters-file) is also used

e.g. --transfers 64 --checkers 128 --fast-list --filter-from/--filters-file ..

### check

~8s on average and between 6.8s to 9.6s

### ls

(using `time` as no info given with -v)

ls: 0m4.088s
lsl: 7m36.975s

### sync

upload:
	initial: 3m57.0s
	subsequent: 18.6s
	
download:
	initial: 2m9.0s
	subsequent: 17.8s

### copy

upload:
	initial: 4m0.0s
	subsequent 18.6s
	
download:
	initial: 2m6.5s
	subsequent: 16.8s

### bisync

These are some of the best and would say are usually a little longer by upto 5 mins this is likely when resync is run when data is already present vs copying the data itself.. There are no changes made to files when moving between a --resync and normal run.  

defaults:
	resync: 10m47.0s
	normal: 6m44.7s

defaults with ignore checksum: (--ignore-listing-checksum --ignore-checksum)
	resync: 10m36.5s
	normal: 6m31.9s

### overview

So as you can see bisync is orders of magnitude slower than `copy` or `sync` . `ls` is incredibly fast as is `sync` and `copy` in both directions (e.g. uses up almost 100% of bandwidth)

I only ran the test of `lsl` and `ls` at the very end and now thinking that bisync relies on lsl as this so incredibly slow (as I believe bisync does not use checksum so would need `lsl` info to compare?).

I can do a local to crypt (local) bisync in 15s (--resync) and 8.7s for subsequent. 

Is there something I am doing wrong? If not, are there plans/options available to rclone to improve the speed of bisync so that it is more in line with 2 x sync/copy commands (e.g. one upload, one download) or is this a limitation that is unlikely to be overcome? Also, if this is due to lsl taking so long is there a way to speed up lsl? 

Thanks to you all for your hard work and a special thank you @nielash for all you've been doing on bisync and continue to do. I as many others massively appreciate it and when this tool is out of experimental stages it will be a game changer for so many. If I had any free time or money right now I would help out but unfortunately the best I can do is give you some benchmarks and user feedback.

Thanks

issue.title: bisync: logger, march, and several big bug fixes

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

A suite of several related fixes tackling bisync's biggest pain points.

Highlights:
- bisync: merge copies and deletes, support `--track-renames` and `--backup-dir` -- fixes #5690 and #5685
- operations: add logger to log list of sync results -- fixes #7282
- sync: report list of synced paths to file -- see #7282
- bisync: generate final listing from sync results, not relisting - fixes #5676
- bisync: rollback listing on sync error
- bisync: generate listings concurrently with march -- fixes #7332
- sync: `--fix-case` flag to rename case insensitive dest -- fixes #4854
- bisync: handle unicode and case normalization consistently - fixes #7270
- bisync: optimize `--resync` performance -- partially addresses #5681
- bisync: add support for Google Docs - fixes #5696

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes. See [this post](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636) and the individual issues linked above.

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
